keyMoments.title: Hancock Returns to Amazon Lily
keyMoments.description: Boa Hancock arrives at Amazon Lily aboard the Yuda to the adoring cheers of her subjects, establishing her as the beloved empress of the Kuja tribe.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of one of the series' most important characters and Luffy's future ally.

keyMoments.title: Refuses World Government Summons
keyMoments.description: Hancock dismisses Elder Nyon's urgent plea to answer the World Government summons, throwing her out of the palace window and putting Amazon Lily at risk.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Hancock's rebellious nature and her deep-seated hatred of the World Government, foreshadowing her traumatic past.

keyMoments.title: First Meeting with Luffy
keyMoments.description: Luffy accidentally crashes into Hancock's private bathhouse, marking their first direct encounter under highly compromising circumstances.
keyMoments.significance: The beginning of the relationship between Hancock and Luffy that will define both characters going forward.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Sees the Slave Mark
keyMoments.description: Luffy sees the Hoof of the Soaring Dragon branded on Hancock's back - her most closely guarded secret that reveals her past as a slave of the Celestial Dragons.
keyMoments.significance: The deepest violation of Hancock's secrets that will ultimately lead to her emotional breakthrough and alliance with Luffy.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Unaffected by Her Beauty
keyMoments.description: Hancock discovers that Luffy is completely immune to her beauty and petrification powers, shocking her as no one has ever been unaffected before.
keyMoments.significance: First crack in Hancock's worldview and the beginning of her developing feelings for Luffy due to his unique nature.
keyMoments.quote: He... he's not affected by my beauty?!

bounties.reason: Former bounty before becoming a Warlord (mentioned in context)

abilities.description: Hancock's ability to petrify those who feel lust or attraction toward her using her Mero Mero no Mi powers.

relationships.description: Luffy crashes into Hancock's bath and sees her slave mark, leading her to order his execution. However, his immunity to her beauty intrigues her.

evolutionMoments.description: First meeting when Luffy accidentally falls into her bath and sees the mark on her back.

relationships.description: Elder Nyon serves as Hancock's advisor, offering political counsel that Hancock often ignores.

evolutionMoments.description: Nyon urges Hancock to answer the government summons but is literally thrown out a window for her advice.

relationships.description: Hancock's younger sister and fellow Gorgon Sister who shares the secret of their slave past.
Hancock's youngest sister and fellow Gorgon Sister who shares the secret of their slave past.

reveals.information: Empress of Amazon Lily and Captain of the Kuja Pirates
One of the Seven Warlords of the Sea
Bears the Hoof of the Soaring Dragon slave mark on her back (seen but not yet explained)
Can petrify people with her beauty using her Devil Fruit powers, but it doesn't work on those who don't feel attraction

name.japanese: ボア・サンダーソニア

keyMoments.title: Returns to Amazon Lily with Hancock
keyMoments.description: Sandersonia arrives at Amazon Lily as one of the Gorgon Sisters, leading the Kuja Pirates crew off the ship.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance as one of Hancock's sisters and the Gorgon Sisters.

bounties.reason: Former bounty before Hancock became a Warlord (context)

relationships.description: Sandersonia's older sister and the empress she serves loyally.
Sandersonia's younger sister and fellow Gorgon Sister.

reveals.information: Middle sister of the Gorgon Sisters
Also bears the slave mark on her back (mentioned in the Gorgon legend context)

name.japanese: ボア・マリーゴールド

keyMoments.title: Returns to Amazon Lily with Hancock
keyMoments.description: Marigold arrives at Amazon Lily as one of the Gorgon Sisters, leading the Kuja Pirates crew off the ship.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance as one of Hancock's sisters and the Gorgon Sisters.

bounties.reason: Former bounty before Hancock became a Warlord (context)

relationships.description: Marigold's older sister and the empress she serves loyally.
Marigold's older sister and fellow Gorgon Sister.

reveals.information: Youngest sister of the Gorgon Sisters
Also bears the slave mark on her back (mentioned in the Gorgon legend context)

keyMoments.title: Warns Hancock About Government Summons
keyMoments.description: Elder Nyon urgently approaches Hancock to convince her to answer the World Government's summons, warning that Amazon Lily will lose its protection if Hancock loses her Warlord title.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Nyon as the voice of reason and political pragmatism in contrast to Hancock's trauma-driven decisions.
keyMoments.quote: A central government ship has arrived demanding your presence, lest you lose your title!

relationships.description: Nyon serves as Hancock's political advisor, trying to guide her empress role despite Hancock's resistance.

evolutionMoments.description: Nyon is thrown out of the palace window when she presses Hancock to answer the government summons.

reveals.information: Former empress of Amazon Lily from three generations before Hancock

keyMoments.title: Appears with Hancock
keyMoments.description: Salome appears alongside Boa Hancock as her constant companion and snake weapon.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of Hancock's iconic snake companion.

relationships.description: Salome is Hancock's loyal snake companion who serves as her throne and constant companion.

reveals.information: Boa Hancock's personal Snake Weapon and companion

keyMoments.title: Desperate Search for a Ship
keyMoments.description: Luffy desperately searches through Amazon Lily for someone who can lend him a ship so he can reunite with his scattered crew.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's single-minded determination to reunite with his crew above all else.
keyMoments.quote: I have to get back to my crew! Someone has to help me get off this island!

keyMoments.title: Crashes Into Hancock's Bath
keyMoments.description: Luffy accidentally falls through the palace roof and lands directly in Boa Hancock's private bathhouse.
keyMoments.significance: First direct encounter with Hancock that will define their future relationship.
keyMoments.quote: I'm drowning! Wait... this water is shallow!

keyMoments.title: Sees the Mark on Hancock's Back
keyMoments.description: Luffy sees the mysterious slave mark branded on Hancock's back, though he doesn't yet understand its significance.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the revelation that will lead to Hancock trusting Luffy with her deepest secret.

keyMoments.title: Immune to Hancock's Beauty
keyMoments.description: Luffy proves completely immune to Hancock's beauty and petrification powers due to his pure-hearted nature and focus on his crew.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Luffy's unique relationship with Hancock and demonstrates his immunity to superficial manipulation.

relationships.description: Luffy accidentally intrudes on Hancock's bath and sees her slave mark, leading her to order his execution. However, his immunity to her beauty intrigues her.

evolutionMoments.description: First meeting when Luffy crashes into her bath and sees her secret.
